properties.sfomuseum:description: Airmail flight cover, part of International Tributes to the History of Flight series by the Postal Commemorative Society; white envelope with full color illustration cachet and inset stamp commemorating first man to break the sound barrier on October 14, 1947, at Edwards Air Force Base, California, U.S.A., by Captain Charles “Chuck” Yeager, U.S. Air Force, with Bell X-1 experimental aircraft; cancellation stamp dated October 14, 1985 at Edwards AFB; includes information on reverse.
